frameDefinitions: An Executive_authority exchanges one penalty, the Original_punishment, for another less severe one, the New_punishment.
An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.
A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.
This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
frameExamples: On December 15, 1971, Governor Winfield Dunn conditionally <t>commuted</t> his sentence to twenty years.
Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
The laborer realized that he <t>activated</t> the machine but did not know how to stop it.
Milton <t>took</t> the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
Shortly after the boy <t>surrendered</t> the gun, the three remaining warriors made a rush for liberty.
The Spaniards <t>conquered</t> the Incas with both the Cross and the arquebus
listRoleDefinitions: The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to commute punishments.
The punishment the <fen>Offender</fen> was originally sentenced to.
The time at which the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>  is commuted.
The location where the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> commutes the <fen>Original_punishment</fen>.
The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The person who takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> prior to the taking.
When the taking takes place.
Where the taking takes place.
The person compelled to transfer the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes possession.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Surrenderer</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Hearst was sentenced to seven years in prison. 1979, <fex>President Jimmy Carter</fex> commuted Hearst's prison sentence after she served nearly two years.
I had learned after all of this period of time has passed the court was about to let (Bush) pay a sum of money and commute <fex>her sentence</fex> to time served.
Israel <fex>yesterday</fex> commuted the lengthy prison terms of seven Jews convicted of murdering or plotting to kill Arabs.
Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
<fex>The night lights</fex> were turned on in the secondary school.
Instantly <fex>Sue</fex> activated the commlink on the wall.
He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex>the wind</fex> turned the shower on in that one upstairs bathroom.
My dad turned the lights on for me <fex>at 10 o'clock</fex>
Suddenly, the lights got turned on <fex>on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.
<fex>Milton</fex> took the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
Milton took <fex>the can of beer</fex> out of the refrigerator.
Milton took the can of beer <fex>out of the refrigerator</fex>.
The government seizure of a suspected dissident's computer <fex>last November</fex> has increased the tension between citizens and law enforcement.
Police seized several tons of marijuana <fex>in Berkeley</fex> last weekend.
<fex>The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> conquered Egypt in the year 525 BC
Britain had an opportunity to conquer <fex>Europe</fex>.
China 's <fex>1997</fex> takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony
<fex>On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to conquer those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.
